item.title: Reaching Across the Isles: UK-LLM Brings AI to UK Languages With NVIDIA Nemotron
item.description: Trained on the Isambard-AI supercomputer, UK-LLM enables AI reasoning for Welsh and other UK languages for public services.

item.title: #WhyIScience Q&A: A structural biologist adopts a new role catalyzing collaborations
item.description: A former drug discovery scientist, Gail Guo now helps advance research into novel cancer drugs as part of Broad’s alliance with Bayer.

item.title: NVIDIA Partners With AI Infrastructure Ecosystem to Unveil Reference Design for Giga-Scale AI Factories
item.description: At this week’s AI Infrastructure Summit in Silicon Valley, NVIDIA’s VP of Accelerated Computing Ian Buck unveiled a bold new vision: the transformation of traditional data centers into fully integrated AI factories. As part of this initiative, NVIDIA is developing reference designs to be shared with partners and enterprises worldwide — offering an NVIDIA Omniverse Read Article

item.title: Remembering David Baltimore
item.description: David Baltimore served as Chair of the Broad Institute Board of Scientific Counselors, was a member of our Board of Directors, and was essential in the formation of the Broad Institute itself. We asked our Founding Director, Eric S. Lander, to share some reflections with the Broad community.

item.title: Now Live: Europe’s First Exascale Supercomputer, JUPITER, Accelerates Climate Research, Neuroscience, Quantum Simulation
item.description: At JUPITER’s inauguration ceremony in Jülich, attended by Germany Chancellor Friedrich Merz, the Jülich Supercomputing Centre and NVIDIA unveiled ways the supercomputer is already spurring innovation across the world.

item.title: Mass General Brigham launches genetic test to predict risk across eight cardiovascular conditions
item.description: Developed in collaboration with Broad Clinical Labs and Mass General Brigham Laboratory for Molecular Medicine, the test provides a comprehensive view of a patient’s inherited heart disease risk. div.hero-section__author { display:none;}

item.title: How massive datasets generated at Broad are powering the latest AI models in biology
item.description: Broad scientists describe how data resources they helped build over more than a decade now form the foundation for cutting-edge AI and genome biology discoveries.

item.title: Breathing low-oxygen air slows Parkinson’s progression in mice
item.description: Low-oxygen air prevented and even reversed symptoms in a mouse model of Parkinson’s disease.

item.description: Discover how AI software is revolutionizing surface finishing by tackling labor shortages, increasing consistency, and accelerating automation.

item.title: Evolved gene editor inserts entire genes in human cells
item.description: The new system is the first to use a DNA-mobilizing enzyme called a CRISPR-associated transposase to make targeted gene-sized edits at therapeutically useful levels in human cells.

item.description: Explore how Microsoft is enabling companies to easily navigate complexities and use technology with connected data chains and AI.

item.description: Implementing Palladyne IQ robotic AI software can help autonomously manage component cleaning, prepare surfaces for the next production stage, and enhance the overall production process across MRO, remanufacturing, and other industries.

item.title: Physical AI: Embracing AI’s Moment in Robotics
item.description: The rise of physical AI is having its breakthrough moment, like ChatGPT did in language processing in 2022. Read more.

item.title: Gene editing extends lifespan in mouse model of prion disease
item.description: A single-letter edit in DNA reduces levels of the disease-causing prion protein in the brain and could lead to a preventative, one-time treatment for the deadly neurodegenerative disorder.

item.description: The new genome-editing tools could lead to safer, more efficient gene therapies.

item.title: Researchers devise new way to target and correct disease-related proteins
item.description: Broad scientists built a diverse library of compounds and found one that stabilizes a dysfunctional protein in Crohn’s disease, demonstrating their library’s potential to uncover new therapeutic strategies.

item.description: AlphaQubit is an AI-based decoder that identifies quantum computing errors with state-of-the-art accuracy.

item.title: New drug triggers rapid cell death in cancer models
item.description: BRD-810 inhibits the MCL1 protein and reactivates apoptosis in tumor cells, displaying therapeutic potential in animal models.

item.title: Anthropic raises $13B Series F at $183B post-money valuation
item.description: Anthropic has completed a Series F fundraising of $13 billion led by ICONIQ. This financing values Anthropic at $183 billion post-money. Along with ICONIQ, the round was co-led by Fidelity Management & Research Company and Lightspeed Venture Partners. The investment reflects Anthropic’s continued momentum and reinforces our position as the leading intelligence platform for enterprises, developers, and power users.

item.title: Claude introduces memory for teams at work
item.description: Claude now remembers your team's projects and preferences across conversations. Memory helps maintain context for complex work, with project-specific boundaries and full user control over what's remembered.

item.title: NVIDIA Unveils Rubin CPX: A New Class of GPU Designed for Massive-Context Inference
item.description: NVIDIA® today announced NVIDIA Rubin CPX, a new class of GPU purpose-built for massive-context processing. This enables AI systems to handle million-token software coding and generative video with groundbreaking speed and efficiency.

item.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
item.description: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the second quarter ended July 27, 2025, of $46.7 billion, up 6% from the previous quarter and up 56% from a year ago. NVIDIA’s Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially.

item.title: Industry Leaders Transform Enterprise Data Centers for the AI Era With NVIDIA RTX PRO Servers
item.description: NVIDIA today announced leading global enterprises have adopted NVIDIA RTX PRO™ Servers — a new category of enterprise data center infrastructure powered by the RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPU — speeding the shift from general-purpose computing clusters to AI factory infrastructure, without a complete data center overhaul.
